org.openadaptor.auxil.connector.jdbc.writer.deprecated.orderedmap
Class SQLStatementConverter

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.auxil.connector.jdbc.writer.deprecated.orderedmap.AbstractStatementConverter
      org.openadaptor.auxil.connector.jdbc.writer.deprecated.orderedmap.SQLStatementConverter
All Implemented Interfaces:
IStatementConverter
Deprecated. Use stored procedure calls and MapCallableStatementWriter instead

public class SQLStatementConverter
extends AbstractStatementConverter

The SQLStatementConvertor is a class to transform an input SQL template into an executable SQL statement. It takes a sql and for each deliver method call on its JDBCWriteConnector it runs the convert method. This class effectively performs the same function as the javax.sql.PreparedStatement

Description copied from interface: IStatementConverter
Do any initialisation required. Called with a valid connection once before convert is called. Calling this method again should reset and state.

Parameters:

validate

public void validate(java.util.List exceptions,
                     Component comp)
Deprecated. 
Checks that the properties for the statement converter are valid. If any problems are found then an exception is raised and added to the supplied list.

Parameters:
exceptions - list of exceptions that any validation errors will be appended to
comp - the component that this converter is connected to

convert

public java.sql.PreparedStatement convert(IOrderedMap om,
                                          java.sql.Connection connection)
Deprecated. 
Converts the sql to a valid statement and returns as a PreparedStatement on the given connection. The values in the given IOrderedMap om are substituted where the keys match in sql.

Specified by:
convert in class AbstractStatementConverter
Parameters:
om - the map containing the keys representing the placeholders and the values to be substituted in the sql.
connection - the Connection to prepare the statement against.
Returns:
the PreparedStatement

replacePlaceHolder

protected java.lang.String replacePlaceHolder(java.lang.String inputString,
                                              java.lang.String matchString,
                                              java.lang.String replacementString)
Deprecated. 
Replaces all occurrences of the given matchString with the given replacementString in the given inputString. Note the matchString must be surrounded by the delimiter character. This method makes no effort to perform SQL escaping, nor does it treat matchString as a regular expression.

Parameters:
inputString -
matchString -
replacementString -
Returns:
the inputString with the replacements made.
